page.title: 07Horningtoft Sign
page.content:
Horningtoft Sign was designed by Dave Stevens and carved by Maurice Reeder and erected in 1980. The sign now stands on private ground by the permission of Mr and Miss Crow on the North West side of the church. The base of the sign is made of stone and concrete which some people put things in so that if the sign were ever dug up others would find them.
There's a rose carved on the stem of the sign that is there for the reason that there used to be a rent house and if you ever lived in it the payment was a rose paid to the vicar on Midsummer's day.Also carved on the sign is a pair of silver scales found in 1870 and an old Norfolk Plough which unearthed a Roman urn.
